justification: Offer ignores Team B’s win-now, ceiling-chasing mindset and reliance on expert rankings; they won’t part with a Tier 1 workhorse for a Tier 4 WR and an out Tier 5 TE. Probability of acceptance is unrealistically high. Trade also conflicts with Team A’s stated avoidance of injured players (Josh Martin is Questionable). While A truly has TE/WR surplus, the rationale is generic and doesn’t address B’s incentives or needs.
